name: highlightcodescan
description: This task will run a CAST Highlight code scan on your project sources to build software analytics
author: CAST Highlight

inputs.name: snapshotLabel
inputs.label: Snapshot Label
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define the label of the project version/snapshot as it will appear in Highlight.

inputs.name: sourcedir
inputs.label: Source Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define the source directory to scan. If left empty, Highlight will scan the root source directory.

inputs.name: exclusiondir
inputs.label: Folder Exclusions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define the source folders you want to exclude from the code scan, separated with a ',' (e.g. tests, third-party libraries, etc.)

inputs.name: scantechnologies
inputs.label: Specific technologies to scan
inputs.defaultValue: ObjCCpp, Ruby, PL1, PHP, Cobol, VbDotNet, Groovy, PlSql, CS, Java, TSql, Python, Abap, Kotlin, CCpp, JSP, Ksh, TypeScript, JS, Swift
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define the technologies you want to include in the scan (if left empty, all supported technologies will be scanned)

inputs.name: keywordscanfile
inputs.label: Path to your Keyword Scan XML file on the Azure Agent (e.g. C:\temp\Highlight\KeywordScan.xml)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define path and file name for the Keyword Scan XML configuration file)

inputs.name: perlinstalldir
inputs.label: Path to Perl library
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define the path to Perl's Strawberry library required to run CAST Highlight analyzers

inputs.name: upload
inputs.label: Automatic Scan Result Upload
inputs.helpMarkDown: When activated, this option will automatically upload the scan results to the Highlight platform (make sure you've defined the required application and account parameters in the build definition variables)
